intro: Ranunculus trullifolius, commonly known as the thimbleweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features finely divided, trifoliate leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with five to eight petals, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, stream banks, and woodland edges. Ranunculus trullifolius is also known for its medicinal properties, historically used to treat various ailments.
